organic_results.title: Institutional correlates of faculty support of campus unrest
organic_results.snippet: Administrative characteristics of 301 nationally representative colleges and universities are related to faculty support of campus activism (in attitude and in behavior). The findings indicate that faculty may provide the link between the incidence of campus unrest and institutional characteristics, independent of student body attributes. The consistently-observed relationship between institutional quality measures and the incidence of unrest is considered in relation to faculty as well as student attributes. The results are discussed in …

publication_info.summary: AE Bayer - Sociology of Education, 1972 - JSTOR
